name: Khimera: Destroy All Monster Girls
description: Play as Chelshia the chimera in this platforming beat-em-up adventure into the wonderful world of monster girls!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Graphics: any DirectX 8 compatible CPU or GPU DirectX: Version 8.0 Storage: 55 MB available space Sound Card: any DirectX 8 compatible sound card Additional Notes: Any PC or laptop built in the last 5 years should have little to no issues running the game.

reviews.review_text: It's a free Shovel Knight clone with Mega Man boss-power theft. This game rules.

I played this game not expecting much. Figured I would waste some time to end the day. Oh boy was I for a treat. Let me just say this , this game is increadible. Our main character Chimera is increadibly versatile. She can dash (which also hurts enemies) , air dash (infinite airdash YEAAAAHHHHHH!!!!!) , pougo jump using her arm and thats not even counting the weapons you get from enemies. Its more like Zero (from megaman games) actually. You dont really get a weapon but a new move or an upgrade to your normal abilities.  The writing is hilarious. I love the every single character in this game even the normal enemies. You can even talk to the checkpoints. The bosses are really fun (albeit a bit easy) , the music is catch as all hell, the level design is rich , and its just overall an amazing game. I can't believe its free. I mean seriously why is this game free?!?!  If you are a fan of Megaman , Shovel Knight , Ducktales or anything in this genre please try this game (its free anyway). Its not a great game for a free title no its a great game in general.
Hey....         That's pretty good.

If you like Megaman, then you'll definitely enjoy this game. With a retro feel and look tied in with modern humor and tones, this lighthearted action platformer is definitely worth playing. Heck, I wouldn't have minded throwing down a couple dollars for the fun.
Why is this game free? It's so good. Hilarious, challenging, fun and the music is amazing.
The fact that i didn't pay for this is a crime.

This game has amazing concepts and mechanics HOWEVER the controllers and the boss fighting are a bit lacking.. You can literally spam the dash attack and win EVERY TIME, just throw yourself with the dash attack and you gonna win, except for Mimi since she has a special mechanic but still.. Other than that, fun game and since it's free why not give it a try?

This is one of the most lovingly-crafted, impressively complex free games I've ever played. It's charming and tough and puts a smile on my face. I would have happily paid money for this game, but it's free, so I would double-recommend it if I could.
Why is it that all the games i'd pay for are free? this was a good time, bad puns decent difficulty. still playing, those A ranks and no deaths wont get themselves
There is no reason NOT to play this game. It suckers you in with its cute writing and retro platformer gameplay and you'll even find yourself getting addicted real quick.   Seriously, just play it.

This is a great game and it's free.  Do you love Shovel Knight or Megaman then this is up your ally.  The controls work nicely and the mechanics are great and you have multiple reasons to replay levels (challenges, collectibles, and even rating scores)   If you want to scratch that sidescroller action/adventure itch totally pick up Khimera: Destroy All Monster Girls

Just finished this gem of a free game, Platforming is solid the dash mechanic feels just right in this game and adds something to the platforming in the levels, unlike other games. Yeah thats about all I wanna write. its fee, it plays like a good classic retro platofmer, heck it plays like an even simplified shovel knight. Would definitely be worth 5 bucks if it was pay to play.
You wouldn't think a free game would be fun but ... this game is proof of it. Challenging with pretty good humor I straight up love it :3

First of all, I love monstergirls. So I was happy to find out this game exists, and happier to find out it's both free and fun. The game is clearly and proudly based off the megaman platform games. Like the megaman games, you make your way through themed stages, each with thier own set of enemies and hazrds that get harder the further you get into the stage before you face a boss and defeat them for a new power like having a double jump, or a charge shot. The game itself is also much more forgiving then most old school platformers. The stages themselves can be tricky, the pirate ship ones having lots of traps that need good timing to avoid. But the bosses are all easy. They leave themselves open for long periods which means rushing in and smashing them in the face is the way to go. The only boss to put up a challenge is the last stage of the final boss, and that's more due to the moving platfroms and the spikes you have to deal with. The game is short, but that's to be expected when it's free. There is stuff to do after you beat all the stages. you can find fairies and books hidden in the stages, and retry for A ranks and Deathless and Beserk runs.

Khimera is a short and humorous beat 'em up that has interesting and fun characters, challenging but fair levels, and an amazing soundtrack. Controls take a bit of getting used to at the beginning and the difficulty curve is a bit wonky at the beginning (depending on where the player starts at) but overall this is a massively enjoyable free game. I highly recommend downloading and playing it.

Khimera: Destroy All Monster Girls is an extremely charming platforming adventure, especially given that it is an indie game on steam. I was shocked by just how much thought and creativity went into each character in the game. Everyone in this game has a distinct personality, making the world seem vibrant and alive. It has been a very long time since I have spent more time running around the HUB world talking to the npcs than actually playing the game. As for the soundtrack, I haven't heard toons as catchy as this since Undertale. While the combat system in this game is a little rough at times, it certainly gets the job done. I give this game two ensusiastic thumbs up. I'd give it more, but sadly I only have two thumbs.

In my opinion the best free to play game on steam its great the music is amazing the characters are good and the humor is great the Combat can be a bit messy at times and you can basically cheese most enemys and bosses by spamming dash but i still give it 9/10  Note:To all those complaining about it being too hard yes it is hard its meant to be a throw back to retro games like megaman when games weren't easy
awsome game
Utterly charming with bright music, great character designs, and perpetually humorous writing. The gameplay is a little mediocre, but still fun. It puts a smile on my face.

Wow, what can I say that hasn't already been said? 'Khimera: Destroy All Monster Girls' is not only an amazing game with a ton of heart, it's really fun as well. This game totally caught me off-guard and came out of nowhere to be one of the most fun games I've played all year. So cool!  PROS: ---------------------------- - Large, fun levels with lots of variety in the gameplay. (The levels kept introducing new mechanics to kept things interesting.) Very well done. - Considerable length (aka -- it's not too short). I took 10 hours to beat the game! (I like to look for secrets ^_^ ) - Great characters and dialogue. The charming characters and funny dialogue kept me smiling. I kept being surprised at how well the characters -- and there are a LOT of them -- were fleshed out. There's a whole world of character development here! - Great music! I often found myself humming the Oil Level's music as I fell asleep. Great stuff!  - Lots of collectibles! This is a big one for me. I love games that reward exploration and this one rewards it in spades. Lots of cool secrets and hidden collectible to find. Love it! - Cute story with memorable characters. This kind of goes along with the third point. Just really well done. - One of the best compliments I can give is that I found the gameplay very compelling. Once I started, I just had to keep playing to see where it went. Just lots of fun. :) - It's free. Yup -- this costs a grand total of $0. I would've gladly paid $9.99 for a game like this -- but here it is, free. (It's so good that I had to buy the 'Doctor's Assisstant' DLC just so I could give the dev *something*. I mean, come on! It's really good! >_<)  CONS: ---------------------------------------- - These are more nitpicks than anything else. I think towards the end of the game I saw one grammatical mistake. - For a while, I thought one jump in the Oil Level (to get to a secret location), was a little too high. (Turns out I wasn't jumping properly -- so maybe that's on me). - I can't really think of anything else. >_<  OVERALL: --------------------------------------- 'Khimera: Destroy All Monster Girls' truly is an excellent game. Others have compared it to 'Shovel Knight' in terms of gameplay, tone and scale -- and I think that's a fair comparison. It really is well done and highly recommended. If you're a fan of platformers (or games full of fun characters), I highly recommend checking it out. Also -- it's free!  FINAL SCORE: --------------------------------------- 9.5 out of 10
Great, fun platform game in the style of Megaman / Shovel Knight. And, of course, the never minor fact that it's free!

TL;DR PLAY THIS GAME  If you love Megaman, Shovel Knight, or platformers in general, you'll love this FREE little gem. FREE to play, great level design, controls, music, and humor make this game great to play. (Humor really reminded of Shantae) If you're the type that finds great replay value in speedrunning, you'll love it. The main game can be pretty short, but you have two different trial/race modes to play, hidden secrets and collectables to find, and trying to max out your scores by collecting all the gems (similar to Shovel Knight's treasure) and perfecting levels. Speaking of speedrunning, the dev is always checking in with the speedrun community. THE DEV IS LISTENING!  I've put in almost 30 hours trying to perfect my runs BEFORE some good updates, and I can definitely see myself putting in more because of how wonderful this game FEELS.  Youve got nothing to lose by playing this game, and the only con I can think of is that the art style may not be to your taste (really not a big deal).
You can tell love was put into making this, and I'd highly recommend it to people that enjoy platformer beat-em-ups.
A free indie game that looks half way to garbage is leagues better than Mighty Number 9. There's a reason to not kill myself but I'll probably still do it anyway.

Mega Man - pew pew + punchy punchy + (cute monster girls x 10) = ?  It's fun, it's solid, it's got a great sense of humor, and, for some strange reason, it's totally free. I would throw money at this if I could.
This game is far more awesome than it has any right to be as a free game.  Requires some tweaking with the controls to get going, but for that low cost of entry, it's a dream.
umm.... i don,t know what to say never mind i kind of like it
It's Shovel Knight if you're poor.

The short version: I would have paid some amount of money for this game for how enjoyable it was.  The gameplay is solid (it plays similarly to Shovel Knight), the pixel graphics are good (not amazing, but definitely good), and the dialogue is an absolute riot. The soundtrack is also exceptional, making use of a wonderful trumpet synth reminiscent of the Touhou Project OSTs.  For being free, you really cannot go wrong with giving this game a play-through.
